msg: New preprint Exposure to social bots amplifies perceptual biases and regulation propensity available

Our paper Comparing measures of centrality in bipartite patient-prescriber networks: A study of drug seeking for opioid analgesics was published in PLoS ONE
Our paper Botometer 101: social bot practicum for computational social scientists was published in Journal of Computational Social Science
I shared with BBC and CNN my thoughts on the use of Botometer by Musk's team in his dispute with Twitter recently
I appeared on Yahoo! Finance live commenting on using Botometer for bot detection and the Twitter/Musk lawsuit
I became an affiliate at Center for Information, Technology, and Public Life, UNC-Chapel Hill
Our paper How Twitter data sampling biases U.S. voter behavior characterizations was published in PeerJ Computer Science
New preprint The landscape of social bot research: a critical appraisal available
I gave a tutorial on how to identify social media manipulation using OSoMe tools at the 2022 Computation + Journalism Conference
I attended ICWSM in person. On Jun 6, I co-organized the CySoc workshop. On Jun 9, I chaired Session 8: Polarization 2. I also won the Best Reviewer Award
My comments on social bots were quoted by The Wall Street Journal, Politico, Yahoo News, and The Washington Post recently
Our paper The Manufacture of Partisan Echo Chambers by Follow Train Abuse on Twitter was published in the Proceedings of ICWSM
Our article How many bots are on Twitter? The question is difficult to answer and misses the point was published in The Conversation
Our paper Algorithmic Agents in the Hybrid Media System: Social Bots, Selective Amplification, and Partisan News about COVID-19 was published in Human Communication Research
Check out our new tool BotAmp, which can compare the bot amplification levels of two sets of tweets
